properties.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 1 at 4:09PM PST until February 3 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with
gusts up to 50 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing
temperatures in the upper 20s to mid 30s will be possible in
wind sheltered areas.

* WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara
County Central Coast.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 8 PM Sunday to noon PST
Monday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Sunday night through
Monday morning.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and
make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, and
other sensitive vegetation.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds late Sunday afternoon into
evening, especially near the coast from Vandenberg to Point
Conception.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for
extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING
